attributes.action: Reduce summer break to 5 weeks and allow flexible school holidays
attributes.additional_details: The six-week summer holiday is difficult for working parents to manage and costly for families. It can also make returning to school harder, especially for children with neurodiversities. A five-week summer break with a flexible week would ease childcare pressures, allow families to holiday outside peak times, and support smoother transitions for children back into school.
attributes.background: Reduce the summer holiday from 6 to 5 weeks and allow schools to use the extra week flexibly during the academic year, outside exam periods and excluding Years 10 and 11 to allow full exam prep.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about term dates are a matter for academy trusts, local authorities or governing bodies.
